summary: Patricia M Orr was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list her name, position, salary, and pay period earnings. She appears in payroll certifications from 1977 and 1978, indicating her employment spanned at least that period. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but they confirm her status as a staff member.
significance: Patricia M Orr's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the documents do not reveal the specifics of her role, her presence on the payroll indicates she contributed to the committee's work. Further research would be needed to determine the extent and nature of her involvement in the investigation.
